text:
Turut mendampingi Mendag Zulkifli Hasan dalam konferensi pers ini, yaitu Plt. Sekretaris Jenderal
Kemendag Suhanto, Dirjen Perlindungan Konsumen dan Tertib Niaga Kemendag Moga Simatupang,
Dirjen Perdagangan Luar Negeri Kemendag Budi Santoso, Staf Khusus Mendag Bidang Perjanjian
Perdagangan Internasional Bara K. Hasibuan, Staf Khusus Mendag Bidang Promosi Perdagangan Dalam
Negeri Hadi Daryanto, dan Staf Khusus Mendag Bidang Peningkatan Ekspor dan Perluasan Pasar Luar
Negeri Alhilal Hamdi.
Anggota Satgas Pengawasan Barang Impor Ilegal berasal dari 11 kementerian dan lembaga. Mereka
adalah Kementerian Perdagangan; Kejaksaan Agung; Kepolisian Republik Indonesia; Kementerian
Keuangan; Kementerian Perindustrian; Kementerian Hukum dan HAM; Badan Intelijen Negara; Badan
Pengawas Obat dan Makanan; Badan Keamanan Laut TNI AL; dinas-dinas yang membidangi
perdagangan di tingkat provinsi, kabupaten, dan kota; serta Kamar Dagang dan Industri Indonesia.
Mendag pun menjelaskan tiga tujuan utama pembentukan satgas tersebut. Pertama, menciptakan
langkah strategis dalam pengawasan dan penanganan masalah impor. Kedua, menciptakan koordinasi
antarinstansi yang efektif dalam pengawasan barang tertentu yang diberlakukan tata niaga impor.
Ketiga, menjalin komunikasi serta informasi antarinstansi terkait dalam pengawasan dan penanganan
trans:
Joining Trade Minister Zulkifli Hasan at the press conference were several key figures: Acting Secretary General
of the Ministry of Trade Suhanto, Director General of Consumer Protection and Trade Order Moga Simatupang,
Director General of Foreign Trade Budi Santoso, as well as Special Staff to the Minister of Agreements of
Special Staff to the Minister of International Trade, Bara K. Hasibuan, Special Staff to the Minister of Domestic Trade Promotion
Hadi Daryanto, and Special Staff to the Minister of Expanding Exports and Foreign Market
Alhilal Hamdi.
The Task Force on Illegal Import Supervision includes members from 11 different ministries and agencies. They
are the Ministry of Trade, the Attorney General's Office, the Indonesian National Police, the Ministry of
Finance, the Ministry of Industry, the Ministry of Law and Human Rights, the State Intelligence Agency, the Agency of
Food and Drug Supervisory, the Naval Security Agency, local offices of
trades at the provincial, district and city levels, and the Indonesian Chamber of Commerce and Industry.
The Minister highlighted three main goals for the task force: First, to develop
strategic actions for monitoring and addressing import issues. Second, to ensure effective coordination
between agencies for overseeing specific goods that fall under import regulations.
Third, to improve communication and information sharing among agencies related to supervision and handling of
